subject: Business
title: Hedging: Protecting Against Downside
description: A 60-second lesson on Hedging: Protecting Against Downside.

hook.text: A farmer locks in wheat prices before harvest using a futures contract. If prices drop, they're protected.

buildup.text: Hedging means taking a financial position that offsets potential losses in another investment.

discovery.text: Options, futures, and inverse ETFs let investors protect portfolios without selling their holdings.

twist.text: Hedging has a cost â€” like insurance premiums. Over-hedging can eat into returns more than the losses it prevents.

climax.text: Airlines hedge fuel prices years in advance. Southwest saved $3.5 billion by hedging before oil prices spiked.

punchline.text: You can't eliminate risk. But you can choose which risks to keep and which to.
